http://www.nytimes.com/2006/10/06/nyregion/07columbiacnd.html?em&ex=1160366400&en=55ae277bf419d580&ei=5087%0A
 
 This is a news story that I am sure you heard about...the more I read the more it seems these college students are nuts. I have seen many speeches at various colleges and it seems there is a growing number of people interputing and being rude and then claiming they had a "right" to do so. Well, if we all have a right to speak whenever we want then I guess they support going into their classroom while they are taking a test and just "protesting" them the whole time. You can protest but this just being an a$$hole about it.

post_info.post_title: College Students shouldn't have a right to Speak

In my opinion the minutemen deserve everything they get.

Although I have an ingrained dislike for the border activists because they try legitimising their work by choosing a name associated with the revolution, I think the students should have known better. imo If they really needed to protest they should have demonstratively left the Auditorium en masse the moment the speaker was beginning.

In my opinion the minutemen deserve everything they get.

 
 This is a bad way to look at things. If I believe you are wrong does this give me the right to do what I want to you?

No. The protest should have remained peaceful, it doesn't look terribly clear as to who caused it not to be, but neither side should have engaged in violence. I just don't have a lot of sympathy with a bunch of idiot vigilantes whining about their rights being infringed.

No. The protest should have remained peaceful, it doesn't look terribly clear as to who caused it not to be, but neither side should have engaged in violence. I just don't have a lot of sympathy with a bunch of idiot vigilantes whining about their rights being infringed.
